summary: James K. Conzelman is identified as a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll certifications for the committee during the period from February 1977 to December 1977. These documents list his name alongside other committee staff, indicating his employment and compensation during that time. The payroll certifications confirm that he performed his assigned duties as a staff member of the HSCA.
significance: James K. Conzelman's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of his duties is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's work during a specific period.
